intro: Austrostipa bronwenae, commonly known as the Bronwen's wiregrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering period usually occurs during the spring, producing pale green to brown flowers that are wind-pollinated. Austrostipa bronwenae is often found in coastal dunes and is considered an important component of local vegetation.
